intro: Schizoboea kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon schizoboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Schizoboea kamerunensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitats.
